name: quix-ts-datalake-sink
shortDescription: Consume data from a Kafka topic and write it to an AWS S3 bucket path.

Variables.Name: input
Variables.Description: Name of the Kafka input topic to consume from

Variables.Name: TABLE_NAME
Variables.Description: Table name for data organization and registration, else defaults to topic name

Variables.Name: HIVE_COLUMNS
Variables.Description: Comma-separated list of columns for Hive partitioning. Include year/month/day/hour to extract from TIMESTAMP_COLUMN (e.g., location,year,month,day,sensor_type)

Variables.Name: TIMESTAMP_COLUMN
Variables.Description: Column containing timestamp values to extract year/month/day/hour from

Variables.Name: CATALOG_URL
Variables.Description: REST Catalog URL for optional table registration (leave empty to skip)

Variables.Name: CATALOG_AUTH_TOKEN
Variables.Description: If using a catalog, the respective auth token to access it

Variables.Name: AUTO_DISCOVER
Variables.Description: Automatically register table in REST Catalog on first write

Variables.Name: BATCH_SIZE
Variables.Description: Number of messages to batch before writing to storage

Variables.Name: AUTO_OFFSET_RESET
Variables.Description: Where to start consuming if no offset exists

Variables.Name: LOGLEVEL
Variables.Description: set application logging level (DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, CRITICAL)

Variables.Name: MAX_WRITE_WORKERS
Variables.Description: How many files can be written in parallel to storage at once (based on partitioning + batch size)
